src:
Dnevi evropskih inovacij so prišli v Ljubljano s podporo EIT Health

04 Nov 2019, 11:40


Dnevi inovacij (iDays) je edinstvena letna serija dogodkov, namenjenih spodbujanju zdravstvenih inovacij med študenti z enodnevnimi programi na akademskih institucijah po Evropi. Slovenija je ena izmed 20 držav EU, kjer so letos organizirani iDays. Dogodek bo potekal 9. novembra, organizira pa ga Ljubljanski univerzitetni inkubator.


Dnevi inovacij (iDays) je edinstvena letna serija dogodkov, namenjenih spodbujanju zdravstvenih inovacij med študenti z enodnevnimi programi na akademskih institucijah po Evropi. Slovenija je ena izmed 20 držav EU, kjer so letos organizirani iDays. Dogodek bo  potekal 9. novembra, organizira pa ga Ljubljanski univerzitetni inkubator.

V vrsti dogodkov v oktobru in novembru se bodo študenti zbrali v 31 organizacijah v 20 državah po Evropi, da bi predstavili in razvili svoje projekte povezane z zdravstvom oz. zdravjem. Dneve inovacij (iDays) organizira EIT Health, vseevropska mreža 140 vodilnih medicinsko-tehnoloških in farmacevtskih podjetij, raziskovalnih ustanov in najboljših univerz, ki jih podpira Evropska unija. Študenti med enodnevnim ali dvodnevnim programom spoznajo praktična orodja za inovacije na področju zdravja in dobijo priložnost za delo v multidisciplinarnih skupinah za reševanje resničnih življenjskih izzivov na področju zdravja.
Slovenski iDay se bo odvijal 9. novembra na Zdravstveni fakulteti Univerze v Ljubljani, gostil pa ga bo Ljubljanski univerzitetni inkubator, ki je EIT Health Hub za Slovenijo. Cilj dogodka je udeležence naučiti, kako se ideje pretvorijo v resnične projekte s poslovno vrednostjo. Organizatorji se osredotočajo na študente, ki razvijajo ideje s širšega področja zdravja. Na dogodku bodo predavatelji in mentorji študente seznanili s praktičnimi orodji za inovacije, natančneje z metodo Design Thinking. Študenti bodo na dogodku iDay oblikovali multidisciplinarne skupine in pod vodstvom strokovnih mentorjev ustvarili rešitve za resničen izziv na temo Bringing Care Home. Konec dneva bodo svoje ideje predstavili komisiji strokovnjakov, ki na vseh lokacijah uporabljajo standardizirana merila za ocenjevanje.  Zmagovalna ekipa bo nato povabljena na zaključni dogodek, ki bo 1. decembra v Parizu, kjer se bodo srečali z vrstniki oz. ostalimi zmagovalci z vseh sodelujočih univerz. Na tem dogodku bodo študentje dobili  podporo in sredstva za nadaljnji razvoj svojih idej, prav tako pa bodo deležni dodatnega usposabljanja o inovacijski metodologiji.
»iDays so zamišljeni kot prvi korak za študente na poti zdravstvenih inovacij. Ti posebni dogodki so spodbudili že na stotine študentov po vsej Evropi, da začnejo svojo pot inoviranja ,« je dejala Mónika Tóth, vodja programa EIT Health InnoStars Regional Innovation Scheme (RIS). »Letos bodo skoraj 40 odstotkov iDays organizirali EIT Health Hubs v srednji, vzhodni in južni Evropi. Ta številka kaže na veliko vključenost razvijajočih se regij v razvoj lokalnih inovacijskih ekosistemov, pa tudi v nadgradnjo kompetenc talentov v regiji.«
Z namenom odkrivanja in razvoja perspektivnih talentov v Srednji, Vzhodni in Južni Evropi, EIT Health podpira te regije v okviru regionalne inovacijske sheme (RIS), kar bo lokalnim predstavništvom (EIT Health Hubs) omogočilo, da v prihodnjih tednih organizirajo svoj Dan inovacij.
Celoten koledar iDays po Evropi si lahko ogledate tukaj.
text:
European Innovation Days came to Ljubljana with the support of EIT Health

04 Nov 2019, 11:40


Days of Innovation (iDays) is a unique annual series of events designed to promote health innovation among students with one-day programs at academic institutions across Europe. Slovenia is one of the 20 EU countries where iDays are organized this year. The event will be held on November 9 and is organized by the Ljubljana University Incubator.


Days of Innovation (iDays) is a unique annual series of events designed to promote health innovation among students with one-day programs at academic institutions across Europe. Slovenia is one of the 20 EU countries where iDays are organized this year. The event will be held on November 9 and is organized by the Ljubljana University Incubator.

In a series of events in October and November, students will gather in 31 organizations in 20 countries across Europe to showcase and develop their healthcare or healthcare projects. health. The Days of Innovation (iDays) is organized by EIT Health, a pan-European network of 140 leading medical, technology and pharmaceutical companies, research institutions and top universities supported by the European Union. During the one- or two-day program, students learn about practical tools for health innovation and are given the opportunity to work in multidisciplinary teams to address real-life health challenges.
The Slovenian iDay will take place on 9 November at the Faculty of Health, University of Ljubljana, and will be hosted by the Ljubljana University Incubator, which is the EIT Health Hub for Slovenia. The goal of the event is to teach participants how ideas are transformed into real business value projects. Organizers focus on students developing ideas from a broader field of health. At the event, lecturers and mentors will introduce students to practical tools for innovation, specifically the Design Thinking method. Students will form multidisciplinary teams at the iDay event and, under the guidance of expert mentors, create solutions to the real challenge of Bringing Care Home. At the end of the day, they will present their ideas to a panel of experts who use standardized evaluation criteria in all locations. The winning team will then be invited to the closing event, which will be held on December 1st in Paris, where they will meet their peers or children. other winners from all participating universities. At this event, students will receive support and resources to further develop their ideas, as well as receive additional training on innovation methodology.
»IDays are designed as a first step for students in the path of health innovation. These special events have already encouraged hundreds of students across Europe to begin their innovation journey, ”said Mónika Tóth, EIT Health InnoStars Regional Innovation Scheme (RIS) Program Manager. “This year, nearly 40 percent of iDays will be organized by EIT Health Hubs in Central, Eastern and Southern Europe. This figure indicates the great involvement of developing regions in the development of local innovation ecosystems, as well as the upgrading of talent competences in the region. "
In order to identify and develop promising talent in Central, Eastern and Southern Europe, EIT Health is supporting these regions through a Regional Innovation Scheme (RIS), which will allow EIT Health Hubs to organize their Innovation Day in the coming weeks.
You can see the full iDays calendar across Europe here.
